qas.question: When did the United States take control of the island?
What happened that allowed the United States to have Guam?
What is the name of the executive order that transferred Guam over to the U.S?
Which two people were exiled to Guam after the Philippine-American war?
In what year did the Northern Mariana Islands pass From Germany to Japan?
Which country exiled Emilio Aguinaldo to Guam?
Which country exiled Apolinario Mabini to Guam?

context: <b5_0><b6_0>The United States<b6_0/><b5_0/> took control of the island in the <a0_0>1898<a0_0/> <a1_0>Spanish–American War<a1_0/>, as part of the Treaty of Paris. Guam was transferred to U.S. Navy control on 23 December 1898 by Executive Order <a2_0>108-A<a2_0/>. Guam came to serve as a station for American ships traveling to and from <b7_0>the Philippines<b7_0/>, while the Northern Mariana Islands passed to Germany, and then to Japan. A U.S. Navy yard was established at Piti in 1899, and a marine barracks at Sumay in <b4_0>1901<b4_0/>.:13 Following the Philippine–American War, <a3_0>Emilio Aguinaldo and Apolinario Mabini<a3_0/> were exiled on Guam in 1901.:vi
